intro: Rhodostemonodaphne napoensis, commonly known as the Napo rhodostemonodaphne, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
